title: Ticket #4960: Change DAGMan to accommodate submit file globbing
description:
We want to modify DAGMan to deal with the new condor_submit globbing feature that can be used to submit multiple-job clusters. I see two aspects of this (at a high level):
  • Fix any ways in which this could break DAGMan functionality (e.g., if you use the globbing feature, will DAGMan get confused?).
  • Possibly modify DAGMan to take advantage of this feature to add new functionality.
remarks:
2015-Mar-26 09:50:51 by wenger:
See the following tickets for condor_submit-related changes: #4913, #4933, #4944, #4819.

At minimum, I suspect that using the functionality in #4819 will break DAGMAN_PROHIBIT_MULTI_JOBS.

Also, DAGMan should report an error if a submit file doesn't have a queue statement in it.

At minimum, we should add some tests using DAGMan in combination with the new condor_submit features.

2015-Mar-26 10:16:18 by wenger:
Note that we might be able to use the new condor_submit -dry-run flag to avoid parsing submit files to figure out whether they're queuing multiple jobs within a proc.
